zone.line: A Discourse on the manners of the
Antient Greeks relative to the subject of
Love.
The A period which intervened between the
birth of Pericles to the death of Aristotle,
is undoubtedly, whether considered with
in itself, or with reference to the
had subsequent
effects which it produced upon the future
destinies of civilised man, the most
memorable in the history of the world.
What was the combination of moral
& political circumstances which produced
so une unparallelled a progress during
that short period in literature & the arts,
why that progress so rapid & so sustained
met with dwindled into so soon recieved
a check & became retrograde are
left to the wonder & conjecture of posterity
problems which the wrecks & fragments
of those mighty philosophers & poets
subtle & profound minds which
obscurel like the ruins of a fine statue
obscurely suggest to us the grandeur &
